reasoning: Reporting incidence of new diagnoses. Childhood Hodgkin lymphoma (ages 0-14) has incidence of approximately 0.3 per 100k total population (or 1.5 per 100k children). Data from GLOBOCAN and pediatric cancer registries.
source: Ferlay J et al. (2007). Estimates of cancer incidence and mortality in Europe in 2006. Ann Oncol. 18(3):581-592
